Legal_Issue: Whether the May 5, 1992 decision of the Cowessess Indian Band #73 Appeal Tribunal was invalid due to lack of procedural fairness
Decision_Outcome: The May 5, 1992 decision was quashed, but its effects were stayed until a new tribunal could rule on the elections' validity
Legal_Rule: Decisions must adhere to standards of procedural fairness, including unbiased tribunal, proper notice, and right to representation
Procedural_Issue: Lack of procedural fairness in the original tribunal's proceedings
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: The tribunal's proceedings lacked procedural fairness
Applicant_Challenge: Challenge to the validity of the tribunal decision based on procedural unfairness
Court_Result: New tribunal ordered to redetermine the appeal following proper procedures and Band custom
Remedy_Requested: Redetermination of the appeal by a new tribunal
Outcome: Decision quashed; effects stayed pending new tribunal ruling
Remedy_Sought: Proper procedural fairness in band election appeal process
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review and re-determination by a new tribunal
Applicable_Process: Band custom and procedural fairness requirements
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Determination of election validity by new tribunal
